justification: Notes B’s conservatism and pitches a low-volatility RB, but ignores B’s stated preference for possession WRs/pocket passers and reliance on expert rankings. Little attention to B’s roster context (RB depth strong, WR depth thin), and no discussion of A’s needs. Trey Adams’ declining role undercuts the ‘safe floor’ claim. The trade is feasible (Tier 4 RB for Tier 5 WR) but the rationale is generic and not well-grounded in the scenario.
